com.google.api.client.auth.oauth2 Documentation Differences

This file contains all the changes in documentation in the package com.google.api.client.auth.oauth2 as colored differences. Deletions are shown like this, and additions are shown like this.
If no deletions or additions are shown in an entry, the HTML tags will be what has changed. The new HTML tags are shown in the differences. If no documentation existed, and then some was added in a later version, this change is noted in the appropriate class pages of differences, but the change is not shown on this page. Only changes in existing text are shown here. Similarly, documentation which was inherited from another class or interface is not shown here.
Note that an HTML error in the new documentation may cause the display of other documentation changes to be presented incorrectly. For instance, failure to close a <code> tag will cause all subsequent paragraphs to be displayed differently.
Class AccessProtectedResource

OAuth 2.0 methods for specifying the access token parameter as specified in in Accessing a ProtectedProtected Resource. @author Yaniv Inbar @since 1.02
Class AccessProtectedResource, void usingAuthorizationHeader(HttpTransport, String)

Sets the {@code "Authorization"} header using the given access token for for every executed HTTPHTTP request for the given HTTP transport.

Any existing HTTP request execute intercepters for setting the OAuth 2 2 access token will bebe removed.

@param transport HTTP transport @param accessToken access token
Class AccessProtectedResource, void usingFormEncodedBody(HttpTransport, String)

Sets the {@code "oauth_token"} parameter in the form-encoded HTTP body body using the given accessaccess token for every executed HTTP request for the given given HTTP transport.

Any existing HTTP request execute intercepters for setting the OAuth 2 2 access token will bebe removed. Requirements:

  • The HTTP method must be "POST", "PUT", or "DELETE".
  • The HTTP content must be {@code null} or UrlEncodedContent.
  • The UrlEncodedContent.data must be {@code null} or or GenericData.
@param transport HTTP transport @param accessToken access token
Class AccessProtectedResource, void usingQueryParameter(HttpTransport, String)

Sets the {@code "oauth_token"} URI query parameter using the given access access token for everyevery executed HTTP request for the given HTTP transport.

Any existing HTTP request execute intercepters for setting the OAuth 2 2 access token will bebe removed. @param transport HTTP transport @param accessToken access token

Class AccessTokenRequest

OAuth 2.0 request for an access token as specified in Obtaining Obtaining an Access Token.

This class shouldmay be used directly onlywhen forno access grant is included, such as when the Client Credentials flow specified inclient is requesting access to Client the Credentialsprotected Flow. resources under Theits control.clientId andOtherwise, .clientSecretuse one of the subclasses, which add custom parameters fieldsto specify the are requiredaccess grant. Call Call .execute() toto execute the request from which the AccessTokenResponse may be parsed. On error, use AccessTokenErrorResponse instead.

Sample usage for Client Credentialswhen the client flow: is requesting access to the protected resources under its control: 

 
  static void requestAccessToken() throws IOException {
    try {
      AccessTokenRequest request = new AccessTokenRequest();
      request.clientIdauthorizationServerUrl = CLIENTBASE_IDAUTHORIZATION_URL;
      request.clientSecretclientId = CLIENT_SECRETID;
     AccessTokenResponse responserequest.clientSecret = CLIENT_SECRET;
      AccessTokenResponse response = request.execute().parseAs(AccessTokenResponse.class);
      System.out.println("Access token: " + response.accessToken);
    } catch (HttpResponseException e) {
      AccessTokenErrorResponse response =
         e.response.parseAs(AccessTokenErrorResponse.class);
      System.out.println("Error: " + response.error);
   }
 }
 
 }
 Other flows follow the same general approach, but instantiating a different
 class customized for that flow with additional custom parameters.

@since 1.0 2 @author Yaniv Inbar
Class AccessTokenRequest, HttpResponse execute()

Class AccessTokenResponse

OAuth 2.0 access token success response content as specified in Access Token Response.

Use AccessProtectedResource to authorize executed HTTP requests based based on thethe .accessToken, for example {@code AccessProtectedResource.usingAuthorizationHeader{@code (transport, response.accessToken)}.

@since 1.0 2 @author Yaniv Inbar
Class AccessTokenResponse, Long expiresIn

(OPTIONAL) The duration in seconds of the access token lifetime. For example, the value "3600" denotes that the access token will expire in one hour from the time the response was generated by the authorization server.
Class AccessTokenResponse, String refreshToken

(OPTIONAL) The refresh token used to obtain new access tokens. The authorization server SHOULD NOT issue a using the samerefresh token when end-userthe access grant type is set to "none".
Class AccessTokenResponse, String scope

(OPTIONAL) The scope of the access token as a list of space-delimited delimited strings. The value ofof the "scope" parameter is defined by the authorization authorization server. If the value contains multiplemultiple space-delimited strings, their order order does not matter, and each string adds an additional accessaccess range to the requested scope. The authorization server SHOULD include the parameter if the requested scope is different from the one requested by the client.
